newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares rise in higher turnover.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares rise in higher turnover.

text.p: 1030 GMT - Polish shares rose for the second session in a row in higher trade and buying was stronger after price fixing. * The main market's WIG index rose 139.1 points, or 0.9 percent, to 15,941.7, the WIG 20 rose 0.8 percent to 1,587.0 and the parallel market's WIRR rose 0.1 percent to 3,448.9. * Turnover rose 17 percent to 124.4 million zlotys on all three markets as 62 issues rose, 24 fell and 17 were flat. Most active Wedel rose 2.6 percent in a 10-million-zloty turnover. Best BESWs.WA started bourse trade at 65 zlotys, 12 percent above issue. NFI units rose 2.1 percent in a 15-million-zloty turnover.
